content:
more conjectures:
altitude would a major, if not even primary, determinant of climate, except at the extremely high latitudes and a narrow equatorial strip. It's overall a very humid place with regular rainfall and never gets very hot or cold, and probably only freezes at the highest altitudes and perhaps sometimes in the circumpolar regions. Most of the planet would then have a humid subtropical climate in the middle altitudes, and in the middle latitudes highland rainforest in the highest altitudes up to the snow lines, and more of a mediterranean climate around the salt lakes. The equatorial band would be tropical rainforest, and the circumpolar regions hemiboreal or boreal type rainforest
